text: Laba patīkama balansēta tumīga gara ar labu krāsu. patiikama siirupaina kokosriekstu garssa ar kllavu siirupu piegarssu pat tonkas pupinnu vai iirisa garssaam. ir labs.

pours oily black, opaque with creamy light brown head. Aroma: dark malt, cocoa, coffee, milk chocolate, maple, vanilla, coconut, hazelnuts... flavour follows aroma: dark malts, huge sticky maple, milk chocolate, cacao nibs, vanilla beans, coconut, hazelnuts, almonds, roasted coffee, roasted - bitter finish, full body, smooth texture, moderate carbonation.

W zasadzie mógłbym przepisać ocenę z wersji podstawowej, ponieważ beczka podkręca nuty waniliowe i kokosowe z wersji non ba, ale nienachalnie, dalej to wszystko świetnie współgra przy tym potężnym syropie klonowym, każdemu łykowi towarzyszy zachwyt i uśmiech. p.s. mam wrażenie, że tu nie jest tak jeszcze świetnie ułożony alkohol jak w podstawce. Ocena jednak ciut wyżej niż normal. Najlepszy imperialny porter jaki piłem i jedno z najlepszych piw ever. Cudo!

Pours pitch black with only a few mokka bubbles that fade quickly. Very big maple in the aroma. The most Ive come across in any beer. Coffee, cocoa, vanilla but no real trace of barrel. Unless that barrel only contained maple syrup. The taste is very maple, coffee forward. Typical Omnipollo roast/bitterness but this time accompanied by a slightly thicker mouthfeel than your noa or yellow belly. Must admit I expected a little more complexity from the barrel. The maple is awsome but I find it a little simple..

Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Chyba najlepsze piwo Omnipollo ever. Sporo skojarzeń z Morning Delight. Potężny syrop klonowy i kawa. Kokos. Wanilia, bourbon. Słodkie, mega intensywne, długie posmaki. Cudowne.

Bottle at NK thanks to Pilsnertest. Aroma is nutty with Nutella, candied sugar and artificial chocolate. Very sweet and syrupy with hazelnut mocha, chocolate and loads of maple syrup. Slightly bitter coffee, maple syrup finish.

Bottle at NK's Ölbar, Sthlm. Aroma is sweet and nutty with som artificial feeling. Taste is very sweet and syrupy with hints of sweetened, artificially flavoured coffee, chocolate, red wine and alcohol. The high alcohol actually helps it. Like the praline in the chocolate box you really didn't want but like more and more as you grow older.

Bottled 33 cl at Ölstugan 1892 Tullen Majorna, Göteborg, on June 3, 2017.Black color, brown head. Sweet, ice-cream, coffee, chocolate, maple scent. Sweet, sirup, maple taste. Ice-cream, coffee aftertaste. Warming alcohol. Medium smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.
Mbcc yellow. Black. Huge syrupy, maple syrupy waffles on nose. Fullish bodied, sweet, smooth, maple syrupy flavour. Med intense, desserty. Could pour it on my pancakes.
Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, yellow session. Aroma has vanilla, maple, coconut and almonds. Taste follows, sweet but not overly so. Roasty coffee and maple notes.

Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Very dark brown pour with a tan head. Tons of maple syrup, chocolate, toffee, roasted coffee, bitter espresso, light barrel notes - all sorts of good stuff. So much maple, we had to rinse the glass 10 times to get rid of it.
Sample @ MBCC, Yellow session. Pitch black pour with a dark tan head. Notes of sticky maple, more maple, chocolate, caramel and some light coffee.

Tap @ MBCC 2017. Pours pitch black with a small dark brown head. Aroma is packed with maple, labre larver, coffee, vanilla, slight coconut. Taste is fudgey, labre larver, maple, some coffee-like notes, toasted cocoa nibs. Super delicious. More coconut wouldve been nice, though. As with the original.
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of maple syrup, bacon, bourbon and vanilla. Taste is sweet with plenty of maple syrup, almost too much. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

April 17, 2017. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Black with a small dense brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted and nutty with lots of bourbon, maple syrup, caramel, toasted coconuts, dark chocolate, 
Taste is sweet, bitter, roasted. Full bodied, oily and creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet and sticky with a balancing roasted note and light warming, caramel, maple, bourbon, coconut, dark chocolate. 
Very good, nice blend of adjuncts and base beer.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2017 Drinked at omnipollo hatt. At the nose clear notes of hazelnut cream and some hints of biscuits with chocolate drops and coconut milk. In mouth is full bodied, hazelnut cream with notes of rosted , the after taste is long and amazing.  Marvellous

Aroma of pancake syrup, artificial, light curry, caramel, butterscotch, no stout really to be found. Taste of fake maple syrup, chocolate sauce, cocoa and caramel. Way too cloying, couldnt finish 20 cl of this shared with 2, if you like to drink artificial maple syrup this will be amazing.

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of chocolate, maple syrup, oak, muscovado sugar, vanilla, roasted notes. Taste is chocolatey and roasted with vanilla and nutty notes. Mouthfeel is smooth and velvety with low carbonation.

Keg @ BBB. Viscous pitch black pour with a sthin mocha head. Big roasty maple chocolate vanilla bourbon barrel nose. Tons of roasted pecans & coconut. Maple level is pretty much insane. Light raisins. Sweet, bitter, malty, roasty & nutty taste. Viscous round slightly boozy decadent mouthfeel. Insane beer with tons of barrel & maple. Awesome nuttiness. Awesome dessert beer. Reminds me a lot of my old favourite ice cream flavour which was maple walnut.

On tap at Brewers Beer Bar, Göteborg. Thick black with tanned head. Heavy chocolate, maple syrup, coconut, slightly roasted. Sweet with low bitterness and low carbonation. This is one crazy good beer!

-

Draught at Brewers Beer Bar, Göteborg. Opaque black. Take all the good things for Lorelei and than add a lot more. Huge body, huge flavors. Lovely coconut, bourbon, vanilla notes. Insane and incredible.

From draft at Brewers beer bar, poured pitch black with a light mocha ring on top. Nose is already such an improvement of the regular lorelei. Way more charred coconut in the nose, the barrel could have added that character to it aswell, thick maple syrup goodness, marshmallows, coconut oil, light oak notes, vanilla, toasted caramel. Taste is like the regular lorelei, but extra thickness of maple, vanilla, and light charred oak. Thick sticky mouthfeel. I wasnt a fan of the regular lorelei out of the bottle, but this is absolutely incredible
